Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and drawing in black-painted outline of a man with a raised hand.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir Robert Ludwig Mond
Bibliographic references: Mond & Myers 1934 / The Bucheum (2:74, pl. LXXVII (no. 204))
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Buch. 204 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
